meanings.definition: A person who fails to pay a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The welsher borrowed money but never returned it.
meanings.sent2: The welsher promised to help but disappeared when needed.
meanings.sent3: The welsher always conveniently forgets to bring money when it's their turn to pay.
meanings.sent4: Being a welsher is like carrying a debt cloud that never rains.
meanings.sent5: The welsher's reputation for not paying back has spread throughout the town.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: She welshers on her commitments more often than not.
meanings.sent2: If you welsher on your word, people will stop trusting you.
meanings.sent3: He welshers on promises like a magician pulling a disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Welshering on agreements is like breaking a fragile promise vase.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of welshering on responsibilities can be severe.
